titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Rumsey Hall Whitfield graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1955. She received her Master of Arts in Teaching from Harvard in 1957. Her mother was Elizabeth Blodgett Hall, who founded Simon's Rock College.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal papers of Margaret H. Whitfield. Materials in the collection include letters, journals, appointment books, personal memorabilia, snapshots, and several printed items. Many of the letters richly document Whitfield's interior life and often contain poems and quotations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
